Spring.Catchphrase: The sleeping flowers blossoms anew as does the love upon the first rays of sunshine.

Proverbs.Content: " Spring is nature’s way of saying, "Let’s party!". "
Proverbs.Author: Robin Williams

Proverbs.Content: " She turned to the sunlight</br> And shook her yellow head,</br> And whispered to her neighbor:</br> "Winter is dead." "
Proverbs.Author: A.A. Milne

Proverbs.Content: " Spring is the time of plans and projects. "
Proverbs.Author: Leo Tolstoy

Proverbs.Content: " What a strange thing!</br> to be alive</br> beneath cherry blossoms. "
Proverbs.Author: Kobayashi Issa

Proverbs.Content: " And the Spring arose on the garden fair,</br> Like the Spirit of Love felt everywhere;</br> And each flower and herb on Earth's dark breast</br> Rose from the dreams of its wintry rest. "
Proverbs.Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Proverbs.Content: " Spring work is going on with joyful enthusiasm. "
Proverbs.Author: John Muir
Proverbs.From: The Wilderness World of John Muir

Proverbs.Content: " Dead my old fine hopes</br> And dry my dreaming but still...</br> Iris, blue each spring "
Proverbs.Author: Shushiki

Proverbs.Content: " April's air stirs in</br> Willow-leaves...a butterfly</br> Floats and balances "
Proverbs.Author: Bashō

Proverbs.Content: " When there is nothing left to learn from the winter, move on to the spring! "
Proverbs.Author: Mehmet Murat ildan

Proverbs.Content: " The point is that the pleasures of spring are available to everybody, and cost nothing. "
Proverbs.Author: George Orwell
Proverbs.From: Some Thoughts on the Common Toad

Summer.Catchphrase: The sun gets brighter and its placid warmth wraps around our hearts reassuringly.

Proverbs.Content: " One swallow does not make a summer, neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy. "
Proverbs.Author: Aristotle

Proverbs.Content: " Green was the silence, wet was the light,</br> the month of June trembled like a butterfly. "
Proverbs.Author: Pablo Neruda

Proverbs.Content: " It was June, and the world smelled of roses. The sunshine was like powdered gold over the grassy hillside. "
Proverbs.Author: Maud Hart Lovelace

Proverbs.Content: " Summertime is always the best of what might be. "
Proverbs.Author: Charles Bowden

Proverbs.Content: " Summer's lease hath all too short a date. "
Proverbs.Author: William Shakespeare

Proverbs.Content: " I love how summer just wraps it’s arms around you like a warm blanket. "
Proverbs.Author: Kellie Elmore

Proverbs.Content: " Again and again, the cicada’s untiring cry pierced the sultry summer air like a needle at work on thick cotton cloth. "
Proverbs.Author: Yukio Mishima

Proverbs.Content: " Sun is shining. Weather is sweet. Make you wanna move your dancing feet. "
Proverbs.Author: Bob Marley

Proverbs.Content: " A perfect summer day is when the sun is shining, the breeze is blowing, the birds are singing, and the lawn mower is broken. "
Proverbs.Author: James Dent

Proverbs.Content: " No one needs Independence. We all just need tea and air conditioners. "
Proverbs.Author: Michelle Franklin

Fall.Catchphrase: The trees adorn beautiful coppery leaves while the cold slowly begins to spread.

Proverbs.Content: " Autumn seemed to arrive suddenly that year. The morning of the first September was crisp and golden as an apple. "
Proverbs.Author: J.K. Rowling
Proverbs.From: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Proverbs.Content: " The tints of autumn... a mighty flower garden blossoming under the spell of the enchanter, frost. "
Proverbs.Author: John Greenleaf Whittier

Proverbs.Content: " Do you remember, the 21st night of September ? "
Proverbs.Author: Earth, Wind and Fire

Proverbs.Content: " Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower. "
Proverbs.Author: Albert Camus

Proverbs.Content: " It looked like the world was covered in a cobbler crust of brown sugar and cinnamon "
Proverbs.Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Proverbs.Content: " Listen! The wind is rising, and the air is wild with leaves,</br> We have had our summer evenings, now for October eves! "
Proverbs.Author: Humbert Wolfe

Proverbs.Content: " On a bare branch a crow is perched - autumn evening "
Proverbs.Author: Bashō

Proverbs.Content: " "I love autumn", Emily said to me. "It wins you over with its mute appeal to sympathy for its decay." "
Proverbs.Author: Nicholas Sparks

Proverbs.Content: " Autumn that year painted the countryside in vivid shades of scarlet, saffron and russet, and the days were clear and crisp under harvest skies. "
Proverbs.Author: Sharon Kay Penman

Proverbs.Content: " When the autumn meets the tranquillity, there you can see the King of the Sceneries! "
Proverbs.Author: Mehmet Murat ildan

Winter.Catchphrase: The silvery cold travels while we celebrate with others the freedom of our souls

Proverbs.Content: " Nothing burns like the cold. "
Proverbs.Author: George R.R. Martin

Proverbs.Content: " What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness. "
Proverbs.Author: John Steinbeck
Proverbs.From: Travels with Charley: In Search of America

Proverbs.Content: " A lot of people like snow. I find it to be an unnecessary freezing of water. "
Proverbs.Author: Carl Reiner

Proverbs.Content: " In the winter she curls up around a good book and dreams away the cold. "
Proverbs.Author: Ben Aaronovitch

Proverbs.Content: " Snow flurries began to fall and they swirled around people's legs like house cats. It was magical, this snow globe world. "
Proverbs.Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Proverbs.Content: " Winter is nature's way of saying, "Up yours." "
Proverbs.Author: Robert Byrne

Proverbs.Content: " Winter changes into stone the water of heaven and the heart of man. "
Proverbs.Author: Victor Hugo

Proverbs.Content: " It seems like everything sleeps in winter, but it's really a time of renewal and reflection. "
Proverbs.Author: Elizabeth Camden

Proverbs.Content: " The wastes of snow on the hill were ghostly in the moonlight.</br> The stars were piercingly bright. "
Proverbs.Author: Maud Hart Lovelace

Proverbs.Content: " Love has different shape, like this falling snow in winter "
Proverbs.Author: Rizki De
